intro: Lastrea grisea, commonly known as the gray lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions through its specialized root system. The species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
